fields.name: ActiveDirectoryId
fields.description: Id of the Active Directory

fields.name: AdName
fields.description: Name of the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume

fields.name: Administrators
fields.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Administrators active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

fields.name: AesEncryption
fields.description: If enabled, AES encryption will be enabled for SMB communication.

fields.name: AllowLocalNfsUsersWithLdap
fields.description: If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.

fields.name: BackupOperators
fields.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Backup Operator active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

fields.name: Dns
fields.description: Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses (IPv4 only) for the Active Directory domain

fields.name: Domain
fields.description: Name of the Active Directory domain

fields.name: EncryptDCConnections
fields.description: If enabled, Traffic between the SMB server to Domain Controller (DC) will be encrypted.

fields.name: KdcIP
fields.description: kdc server IP addresses for the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume.

fields.name: LdapOverTLS
fields.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be secured via TLS.

fields.name: LdapSearchScope
fields.description: LDAP Search scope options

fields.name: LdapSigning
fields.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.

fields.name: OrganizationalUnit
fields.description: The Organizational Unit (OU) within the Windows Active Directory

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator, value is masked in the response

fields.name: PreferredServersForLdapClient
fields.description: Comma separated list of IPv4 addresses of preferred servers for LDAP client. At most two comma separated IPv4 addresses can be passed.

fields.name: SecurityOperators
fields.description: Domain Users in the Active directory to be given SeSecurityPrivilege privilege (Needed for SMB Continuously available shares for SQL). A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

fields.name: ServerRootCACertificate
fields.description: When LDAP over SSL/TLS is enabled, the LDAP client is required to have base64 encoded Active Directory Certificate Service's self-signed root CA certificate, this optional parameter is used only for dual protocol with LDAP user-mapping volumes.

fields.name: Site
fields.description: The Active Directory site the service will limit Domain Controller discovery to

fields.name: SmbServerName
fields.description: NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the Active Directory

fields.name: StatusDetails
fields.description: Any details in regards to the Status of the Active Directory

fields.name: Username
fields.description: A domain user account with permission to create machine accounts
